articles.title: Researchers Transform Bacteria into Efficient Cellulose-Producing Mini-Factories - Technology Networks
articles.description: ETH researchers have modified certain bacteria with UV light so that they produce more cellulose. The basis for this is a new approach where the researchers generate thousands of bacterial variants and select those that are the most productive.

articles.title: Ancient Ecosystem Discovery Pushes Back Emergence of Complex Life By Over 1.5 Billion Years - Times Now
articles.description: Published in Precambrian Research, the study reveals a unique ecosystem in the Franceville Basin near Gabon, Central Africa, dating back over 2.1 billion years—significantly predating the widely accepted emergence of animals around 635 million years ago.
